website_summaries.verdict: This paper stands out because it is designed to work with a wide variety of writing implements and ink jet printers as well as laser printers.
pros: Promises to allow you to write underwater
Print may fade but doesn't smear in water
Works very well for printing maps to take out hiking or on a trail where you may encounter perspiration or wet conditions
cons: Paper is designed to absorb ink and does not work well with pencils

customer_reviews.title: Survives a lot of splashing.
customer_reviews.text: I use this paper for maps of the rivers and wetlands I canoe. Printing with a regular inkjet, the colors seem normal; I do have to increase contrast, but that may be a function of the data source. The maps get wet from splashing, but never shred. The color holds well unless you let water sit on it a while, then it tends to fade, but doesn't run. So this works well for me.
customer_reviews.author: USMN0429

customer_reviews.title: Inkjet printable!
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a school project that involved a how-to on tying knots. I printed it in my Epson inkjet printer and it worked out well. One thing I’m not too crazy about is how you can scratch the paper lightly and it leaves a shiny mark, but that seems to be the case with all paper that’s waterproof. My kids had a good time trying to rip this paper...it just stretches out instead of tearing :)
customer_reviews.author: Sara Whitlock

customer_reviews.title: This paper is in fact water proof and printable on ...
customer_reviews.text: This paper is in fact water proof and printable on my ordinary home computer! I use it to print outdoor benchcards at a greenhouse and it holds up in the rain and sun!
customer_reviews.author: saand

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this to make waterproof, tear proof alternative ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to make waterproof, tear proof alternative communication boards for children at a special needs camp. I printed with a color laser/led printer. It worked perfectly. No smudges, they took them swimming and could point to pictures or letters to communicate.
customer_reviews.author: NerdReader

customer_reviews.title: Great paper for printing progress cards
customer_reviews.text: It is very good weatherproof paper. Used it in my laser jet and it did great Like the tear resistance factor as well. We are using it for scouting to make a Knot tying progress card for the scouts to carry and get signed off as they complete.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I actually only need more since I gave ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second package that I've bought of this brand of waterproof paper. I use it to print decompression tables for diving... yes I take this stuff underwater, a couple hundred feet under water. Works great. I actually only need more since I gave away a large number of pages of my previous package to other people.
customer_reviews.author: Delkarius

customer_reviews.title: kind of like plastic wrap
customer_reviews.text: Got these to make 1-page quick-start guides. Having not used type before, the paper felt strange, almost "plastic-y." Used in color laser after color calibration. Will tear, kind of like plastic wrap.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for epoxy resin crafting
customer_reviews.text: A perfect solution for people who work with epoxy resin and prints. No more stains! Just be sure to use sealer spray to prevent micro bubbles.
customer_reviews.author: Karen H. O. Brien

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Weatherproof
customer_reviews.text: This paper worked very well for me. I have printed maps and satellite photos of hiking trails on this paper using my inkjet printer. The images look great. Out of curiosity, I tested its weatherproof-ness by running it under the faucet. The only way I could get a little ink to run was if I heavily rubbed an area with my thumb while under running water. But even then, the image didn't smear because the loosened ink didn't re-adhere to the paper. This paper is also very strong and resists tearing. If you try to rip it like normal paper, it will only stretch a bit. Folds easily.
customer_reviews.author: E. Payne

customer_reviews.title: I switched to this from Adventure Paper
customer_reviews.text: This paper works very will for printing durable color maps on an inkjet printer. I write on the backs with ball point pen, and neither side smears.
customer_reviews.author: Denis

customer_reviews.title: Ink smears
customer_reviews.text: Printed a color topo map & black text using my Canon MG6320 inkjet. Ink smears all over and the paper gets soaked with water. I can't believe I spent this much money on such a crappy product. Much better to just print out a map on regular paper and stick it in a ziploc or laminate it.
customer_reviews.author: Motorlegs

customer_reviews.title: Looks like weather proof but that is all you will have at a cost.
customer_reviews.text: Paper is very yellow so cl color print out is very off. Heat laminate is not compatible.
customer_reviews.author: Mang

customer_reviews.title: Great waterproof paper
customer_reviews.text: 4 of 5 stars. Works great but the only negatives if any are it is not very white paper, it has a yellow hue to it. Also it did show very slight water drops, but very negligible....I must say it is impressive. The black inks don't seem to dry completely and do smudge if rubbed, but this could very much be due to the ink not the paper. Works great for inkjet printers and very water and tear proof. Excellent for outdoor signs without having to do any extra lamination. I highly recommend the product and great price compared to the other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Barrasso

customer_reviews.title: Not weatherproof
customer_reviews.text: These turn to dust and crack apart in a matter of weeks exposed to the elements. I suppose if you kept them in a plastic bag it would help but that kind of defeats the purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Architect

customer_reviews.title: Using an Epson Artisan 1430 and the ink smeared and ...
customer_reviews.text: Using an Epson Artisan 1430 and the ink smeared and faded no matter how long I waited for it to set. The black ink looked gray after it was wet.
customer_reviews.author: C. Bobb

customer_reviews.title: We have used another brand that works great, but can only print on one side
customer_reviews.text: We needed this paper to work with an inkjet printer (as advertised). I does not work on either side. The ink runs. We have used another brand that works great, but can only print on one side. This purchase was such a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Emily C Williams

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I use this paper primarily to (1) print out trail maps for hiking trips and (2) make log pages for geocaches that I place. This paper has worked perfectly for both uses. It's rugged and definitely waterproof, but still runs through my printer easily and can be written on with pen (although pencil is a little tougher). Great stuff overall, and a great value compared to Rite in the Rain products I've used before.
customer_reviews.author: Dealhunter

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: While this paper is meant for outdoor use in inclement weather I find that printing business cards makes the cards almost indestructible. I also create and print bookmarks for the church from the same paper for the same reasons. Printing on this paper with an inkjet or laser printer also makes the printing waterproof. Great stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Bill Davis

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff
customer_reviews.text: We use iGage Weatherproof Paper for a custom emergency check list posted on charter fishing boats. We use a Laser printer, you can leave it out in the rain, sun;etc.. We will continue to use iGage, it really takes a beating.
customer_reviews.author: Marlasjoy

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Does just what they say it will do. It is waterproof and I have printed maps on both sides. I have had maps soaked in sweat and rain. The ink did not run and the maps were usable. I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Kridelbaugh

customer_reviews.title: Great Paper, Great Deal
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this paper to print star maps for our cub scout pack. I had printed a few copies on weatherproof paper that my husband bought at our local office supply store. I purchased this paper for less than 1/2 of what he paid, and the quality is just as good. I didn't test the weatherproof aspect, but durability is apparent. Great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Cherry Bruns

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I used this paper to print labels for drinks and food at my wedding. After a test print on my inkjet printer, I ran water over the paper. Some extra ink was rinsed off, but the ink that had penetrated the paper didn't move. I am impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Success
customer_reviews.text: Excellent paper. Used to make maps for Canoe Orienteering. HP ink slightly smeared when wet. Epson ink did not smear, but pink came through to the other side when wet when printed on both sides. Still readable. Will purchase and use again.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: This is very good as weatherproof paper. Just a regular ink jet printer works great on it--no special ink needed. It can be printed on both sides. My ordered arrived very quickly and in good shape which I appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: TNWoman

customer_reviews.title: My laser printer hated these. I pretty much ruined the whole batch ...
customer_reviews.text: Meh... rather soft and somewhat flimsy. My laser printer hated these. I pretty much ruined the whole batch trying to print double sided.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck K

customer_reviews.title: Great for Geocaching Logs!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Rite in the Rain Inkjet paper for years for geocaching logs - but they discontinued it! I tried their line of laser printer paper, but it does NOT work in an inkjet printer, just as warned. Several other types of paper didn't work well either. I finally found this via a comment in a geocaching forum - it never did turn up when I did searches on Amazon. I've tried it and it works great - just as well as the original paper I was using. Prints beautifully and rolls up great for insertion into match tubes. Glad I found it and please keep making it! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Jones

customer_reviews.title: Tough Paper
customer_reviews.text: We use this paper to tag crates in our warehouse and at times they exposed to the elements. To date I have had no problems with this paper and it saves me about $15 per box over the HP version. Great product!!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon R.

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof Paper!
customer_reviews.text: Works Great, needed paper to put inside a Construction Notice Board to protect it from the elements, rain and snow!
customer_reviews.author: Eric L.

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly for recording data at an Open Water Swim ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for recording data at an Open Water Swim Competition. Sheets got wet but they remained legible and intact
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A 'must have' for Important documents
customer_reviews.text: This paper is not only waterproof, it's tear proof as well. I've tried others and I was disappointed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Marian Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Great for printing trail maps
customer_reviews.text: I have used this paper before on the JMT trail, and it really holds up! Can print on both sides, color looks good from my basic color printer. Has lots of other applications I'm sure.
customer_reviews.author: SusanBusfield

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Printed a map out on this paper and threw it in the sink, it dried off with a towel just fine and has held up being folded and taken out of my pockets constantly during hikes with no damage. Will buy more after I use all the sheets
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Van Deusen

customer_reviews.title: great stuff
customer_reviews.text: We are using this for labels on our yarns. Works great. Won't have to redo if labels become damp.
customer_reviews.author: Janet G. Wray

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised.
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my HP inkjet. Be cautious when writing on this paper with a fine ball point pen, you can tear it. It is not tear proof paper.
customer_reviews.author: RickDonkel

customer_reviews.title: shoulda known it was too good to be true
customer_reviews.text: It is better than a regular sheet of paper, but by no means is the image weatherproof. The color image printed on it is not very bold in color compared to regular prints, and as soon as it got moist or wet the color washed away like watercolor leaving only a faint image (maybe functional for maps, but not for photos). The paper is like plastic, so it does not deteriorate in the rain, but forget about using it for anything besides like a black and white map that you dont need to look good.
customer_reviews.author: Heather H

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This item was just what i expected and fit my needs perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Charity LaTray

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BOTHER
customer_reviews.text: this paper STINKS! it is expensive; is not only not waterproof, it fades the colors and runs in the rain! don't waste your money like I did! if I could give this a zero star review I would but can't figure out how to submit this without giving at least 1 star (which it certainly does not merit!)
customer_reviews.author: Corinne Apostle

product_meta.title: iGage Weatherproof Paper 8.5"x11" - 50 Sheets
product_meta.description:
Weatherproof Paper is excellent for extreme outdoor, marine and field use. It is even possible to write on Weatherproof Paper underwater with a standard ink pen (gas charged write-anywhere pens do best underwater.) It is not possible to write on this Weatherproof Paper with a pencil.

AMAZON.COM
Ideal for extreme outdoor, marine, and field use, iGage's weatherproof paper absorbs ink in almost any situation, including underwater. The paper is made of a coated, single-layer, porous synthetic film with inherently superior ink absorption qualities, regardless of whether you're using a standard ink pen, highlighter, whiteboard marker, or permanent marker. Simply scribble or jot your handwritten note onto each puncture- and tear-resistant page, and you'll enjoy permanent, indelible results. As an alternative, users can also run the paper through an inkjet or laser printer, where the base film bonds tightly with the ink and toner to produce highly defined, richly colored images. Users can even write on the paper when scuba-diving or snorkeling by using a gas-charged space pen. 

 Because of the waterproof surface, the paper excels as a base for maps, signs, banners, medical charts, ID tags, hunting permits, and more. In addition, the material won't peal over time, so you won't need to seal any edges or laminate any printed pieces. The paper even folds and glues easily while fitting inside most copiers--just like traditional paper--and withstands both the embossing and laminating process should the need arise. So do away with paper and ink that run at the first sight of a sprinkle and protect your vital information with iGage's waterproof paper. 

 Note: The paper doesn't bond with pencil lead or certain types of inks (depending on the type of printer ink you use), so be sure to order in small quantities at first. This particular bundle includes 50 sheets of 8.5-by-11-inch paper.
feature_bullets: 50 sheets of 8.5-by-11-inch waterproof paper for outdoor, marine, and field use
Coated, porous synthetic film base absorbs ink in almost any situation, including underwater
Works with standard ink pens, highlighters, permanent markers, and some inkjet and laser printers
Bonds well with printer ink and toner to produce highly defined, richly colored images
Prints beautifully on both sides; can be folded, glued, embossed, and laminated
